summary:
Magna Carta is a historic document signed by King John in 1215. It promised to protect people's rights, like having fair trials and not being imprisoned without a good reason. This was important because it limited the king's power.

After some changes, it became a symbol of freedom and was used as a model for laws in England and other countries, including the United States. Today, parts of Magna Carta are still important in English law. It is seen as a key moment in the fight for individual rights and a fair government.
title: Magna Carta
